relevant_findings.general_exam: The patient had difficulty walking in a straight line. The remainder of the general physical examination was normal.
relevant_findings.neurological_exam: A few beats of horizontal nystagmus with left and right far lateral gaze, fatiguing and decreased sensation to all stimuli on the right foot and calf, mild ataxia on tandem gait; the Romberg test was positive.

relevant_findings.lumbar_puncture: Opening pressure of 14 cm of water. Cerebrospinal fluid was clear, glucose level of 64 mg/dL, protein level of 65 mg/dL, with cellular count of one red cell and one white cell per cubic millimeter.
relevant_findings.neurological_exam: Continuous focal slowing in the right hemisphere on EEG.
Signs of cognitive deterioration with errors in orientation, slow responses, and naming difficulty.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening gait instability confirmed by family members.

relevant_findings.neurological_exam: Confusion, action tremors on the left side, asterixis, ataxic tremor in arms and legs.
Somnolent, blunted affect, visual tracking impairment, slow saccades, moderate action tremor, myoclonus in upper extremities, fasciculations in legs.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening of neurological status with persistent symptoms.
